subject: RE: [junit] JUnit4 extension mechanism concerns
msgSnippet: Jon, We are also struggling with making TestClassRunner more generally applicable. I would like to see particular usage scenarios that would be helpful to you.
messageBody:
Jon,

We are also struggling with making TestClassRunner more generally
applicable. I would like to see particular usage scenarios that would be
helpful to you.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Jon Skeet
> Sent: Thursday, November 24, 2005 12:20 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JUnit4 extension mechanism concerns
>
> From what I've seen of JUnit4, the main extension mechanism is to use
> the RunWith annotation, and this replaces the "normal" use of
> TestClassRunner with the specified runner.
>
> Unfortunately, this means that all the work done by TestClassRunner is
> then wasted. As a very concrete example of this problem, I
> can see great
> benefits in using parameterised tests (more on that in
> another mail) but
> I could easily want to use them in conjunction with
> @BeforeClass/@AfterClass (whether another "level" of setup/teardown,
> taking place after all the tests for a particular parameter
> set would be
> good or not is an open question in my mind). Additionally, I can see
> there potentially being other extensions which I'd want to use in
> conjunction with each other.
>
> I can't see a neat way round this without being prescriptive about the
> kinds of extensions which are available (at which point you
> could chain
> certain types together - introspectors which found or removed possible
> tests, for example). I thought I'd raise it as a concern though. (I
> admit I'm less concerned than I was before I saw that @Before, @After,
> expected exceptions and timed tests are all handled by
> TestMethodRunner
> rather than TestClassRunner.)
>
> Any thoughts?
>
